item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds is Having Some Trouble on Steam
item.description:
Summary

  • Monster Hunter Wilds players are experiencing technical issues on Steam, leading to negative player reviews and a "Mixed" review rating.
  • The technical issues include game and system crashes, shaders not loading with Nvidia and AMD GPUs, and visual glitches.
  • Capcom released a PC troubleshooting guide for Monster Hunter Wilds, but players are still frustrated with ongoing issues.

Monster Hunter Wilds has experienced some trouble on Steam during release day, with many players reporting technical issues and other bugs while attempting to launch or play the game. The issues led players to submit negative reviews of Monster Hunter Wilds on Steam, and Capcom released a PC troubleshooting guide to help those encountering issues.

Released on February 28, Monster Hunter Wilds quickly reached an incredible milestone on Steam with well over a million players at its all-time peak. Heading into the game's launch, Monster Hunter Wilds received widespread acclaim and earned a "Mighty" rating on OpenCritic, thanks to its 89 average score and 95% recommendation rate from critics. The game's launch was far from perfect for fans, however. Monster Hunter Wilds faced scrutiny from its player base due to the game's microtransactions, and now, Steam players are unhappy with the issues they're facing in the PC version.

Monster Hunter Wilds' review rating is now "Mixed" on Steam, with thousands of players sharing their experiences running into technical issues and other problems in the game's user review section and Steam forums. Many players are reporting instances of game crashes, shaders not loading with Nvidia and AMD GPUs, and even critical system crashes, which cause blue screen errors. Others cite a lack of optimization in the comments section under Capcom's troubleshooting guide for Monster Hunter Wilds on PC, with some wanting Capcom to remove the Denuvo anti-tamper software from the game.

Monster Hunter Wilds Steam Players are Encountering Bugs and Technical Issues on PC

The troubleshooting guide for Monster Hunter Wilds on PC outlines steps and suggestions that players should follow if they face certain issues, such as crashes and graphics-related anomalies. Capcom recommends players update their graphics drivers, turn off compatibility mode, and add Steam and Monster Hunter Wilds to the exceptions list of users' antivirus software programs, to name a few. However, many Monster Hunter Wilds players are frustrated that they're still having trouble running the game.

Although Capcom hasn't shared a statement on Monster Hunter Wilds' Steam issues following the release of the troubleshooting guide, the company did open its official "Monster Hunter Status" Twitter account on February 28. The Twitter account is dedicated to giving fans updates on server status and known issues in Monster Hunter Wilds . It's also another avenue that fans have for sending inquiries to the Monster Hunter Wilds support team. Despite the trouble that Steam players are facing, it's likely that Capcom is already working on major fixes, and Monster Hunter Wilds will receive multiple post-launch updates in the months to come.

item.title: Cookie Run Kingdom: Frost Queen Cookie Build And Best Toppings
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Toppings Build Guide For Frost Queen Cookie
  • Swift Chocolate Build
  • Attack Topping Build
  • Frost Queen Cookie's Crystal Jam Skill

Cookie Run Kingdom’s Frost Queen Cookie is a Legendary Magic cookie that places itself in the middle of the party in order to remain protected by the front while casting magic at all targets. Frost Queen Cookie was made available in part one of the Frost Witch and the Lantern in the Snow update. Seen as cruel, due to her harsh demeanor and strict morals, Frost Queen Cookie remains fair and just in her maintenance of what is right and wrong.

Once known as Frost Cookie, Frost Queen Cookie's role in Cookie Run Kingdom quickly changed after her passing due to frost illness. Upon returning to the world in Cookie Run Kingdom , Frost Queen Cookie took on her new role and maintained the will of nature, the very thing that led to her demise.

Frost Queen Cookie can be a lethal member of the team if properly equipped with the correct tools. She brings plenty of HP and Attack power, and has a Crystal Jam that can make her exponentially stronger when adjusted. However, if players wish to bring out Frost Queen Cookie's true power, Toppings are a must.

Players can pick up some Toppings by traveling around the World Exploration stages or taking a Balloon Expedition. Up to five Topping pieces can be equipped on one grid, and it's recommended to use five of the same type of Toppings in order to receive a supplemental bonus. This guide will help with the best possible build and what the crystal jam can do.

Updated on February 28, 2025, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Frost Queen still remains one of the most powerful Legendary cookies in the game, thanks to her special ability that helps with almost every build of cookies in general. However, it is important to take Frost Queen to a journey with the right build.

While decreasing a cooldown of 15 seconds for this cookie seems to be crucial, there are also other builds that can help with her damage output and other important stats. And at the end of the day, it really depends on the player's combination of cookies.

Toppings Build Guide For Frost Queen Cookie

Frost Queen Cookie earns her Legendary status, as she is one of the strongest Magic cookies in Cookie Run Kingdom . Her ability, Freezing Squall, casts an Ice-type attack that freezes all enemies on the field and gives them Frozen debuffs. While frozen, the enemies' cooldown is completely stopped, rendering them unable to attack. Not only is Frost Queen Cookie immune to the Frozen status, but when the ability is activated, she is also immune to interrupting effects.

  • Single Hit DMG: Base 67.8% - Max 127.7%
  • Freeze: 2.0 seconds
  • DMG After Freeze: 271.2% of ATK; targets resistant to Freezing receive only 70.0% of DMG (Max - 510.8%)
  • Frost: Enemies hit by Freezing Squall are affected with -10.0% ATK SPD, Freeze DMG +140.0% (capped at 350%) for 20 seconds

Swift Chocolate Build

Swift Chocolate is the ideal topping to build Frost Queen Cookie around, as its main priority is to reduce a cookie's cooldown. Frost Queen Cookie's Freezing Squall and Crystal Jam ability are devastating attacks that players will want to use often, and bringing down the cooldown as much as possible will guarantee multiple hits in one battle.

Since Frost Queen Cookie's defense is her biggest flaw, packing in some DMG Resist as a secondary substat is ideal, as it will keep her in play for as long as possible. Other secondary stats to consider are CRIT%, to land powerful blows that do more damage, and CRIT Resist, which goes hand-in-hand with DMG Resist.

Any Swift Chocolate topping will do with these substats boosted, and using five in the grid will provide Frost Queen Cookie with an additional 5% cooldown decrease. Consider the Frosted Crystal Swift Chocolate, as these special Toppings have a better chance at increasing favorable stats.

Attack Topping Build

Instead of spending all the toppings on Swift Chocolate to reduce the cooldown, players can also invest some of the toppings to increase the CRIT chance using the Juicy Apple Jelly toppings. This topping adds 3% to the CRIT chance at its base level of the Epic version, and upgrading the topping provides even more stat boost.

One or two Juicy Apple Jelly toppings will be enough, with Searing Raspberry, Bouncy Caramel, and Swift Chocolate taking the other spots left. These will help with the normal damage output and attack speed of the game while reducing the cooldown to an acceptable extent.

Knowing that Frost Queen usually stands in the middle line, it's not worth it to place any defensive toppings on the build, as she is not the center of focus against the incoming damage from the enemies.

Frost Queen Cookie's Crystal Jam Skill

If Frost Queen Cookie's main ability wasn't enough for players, her Crystal Jam skill, Eternal Frost, is sure to leave all enemies caught in its blast frozen in fear. The attack sends a blizzard at all enemies on the field, causing Frost upon the final hit, and granting Frost Queen Cookie immunity against ATK Speed changes. Here is a full breakdown of Eternal Frost's abilities.

  • (Rally Effect) Team's Ice-type DMG: +30% (+40% at Level 30)
  • Freeze: 35.0% chance when all allies deal Ice-type DMG to a Frost target Freeze Duration - 1.0 second
  • DMG After Freeze: 115% of Frost Queen Cookie's ATK
  • Blizzard's Periodic DMG:​​​​​​ ​ Up to x10 hits over 2.3 sec; 29.3% DMG per hit (48.8% at Level 30)
  • Shard of Eternal Frost DMG:​​​​​ ​​ 306.5% of ATK (510.8% at Level 30)
  • Freeze: 2.5 seconds
  • Chill: DEF -65.0%, MOV SPD -50.0% for 15 seconds
  • Additional DMG After Freeze: 213.2% of ATK, 70% of DMG for targets immune to Freezing
  • Blizzard Targets Frost: ATK SPD -10.0%, Freeze DMG +150.0% (capped at +350%) for 20 sec (stacks up to x5)

Additional Enchants grant Frost Queen Cookie with the following:

  • At Level 10 - Area Damage after Freeze: 354.4% of ATK
  • At Level 20 - Ice-type DMG Received by Enemies: +25.0% for 5 seconds and Blizzard Targets: Amplified Debuffs +12.5% for 5 seconds, stacks up to x2
  • At Level 30 - Blizzard will ignore 40.0% of DMG Resist

Finally, Frost Queen Cookie will gain Ascension Buffs at increments of leveling up:

  • 1A Effect - Frost Queen Cookie's HP +5.0%
  • 2A Effect - Frost Queen Cookie's DEF +7.0%
  • 3A Effect - Frost Queen Cookie's ATK +5.0%
  • 4A Effect - Frost Queen Cookie's DMG Resist +5.0%
  • 5A Effect - Gains Curse Protection upon entering the battle, additional Curse Protection every 30 seconds

item.title: Avowed: How To Get "The Disappointer" Unique Pistol
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get the Disappointer Unique Pistol in Avowed

Avowed features a wide variety of unique weapons and armor that come with special buffs and talents. The Disappointer is a unique pistol that players can get their hands on pretty early in the game. It offers pretty useful talents, including the one that lets it apply a debuff on enemies, reducing their damage by 10%. If this weapon is something that can complement your ranger build, check out how to get it below.

How to Get the Disappointer Unique Pistol in Avowed

Players can get The Disappointer unique pistol from a merchant located in the Paradis Hightown in the Dawnshore region of Avowed . You'll need to simply travel to the High Market fast-travel beacon inside the Paradis Hightown. After spawning in the market, keep heading toward the northwest corner of the area, through the alleyways.

Meeting the Hidden Merchant

After arriving at the marked location, you'll meet a hidden merchant named Kerdhed "Cutty" Colen . If it's the first time you're interacting with him, he'll engage you in a conversation. He'll ask how an Aedyran came to see his wares, as he wasn't expecting the Envoy to go scourging around in alleyways.

As the conversation goes on, he'll introduce himself as a trader of lost things. If you have a level 2 intellect stat, you'll be able to accuse the merchant of being an ordinary fence . This will allow you to either take the high road and threaten to shut the merchant down or demand a bribe from him.

Purchasing The Disappointer Pistol

Either way, opt to see the merchant's wares, and you'll be able to buy The Disappointer unique pistol from him. The pistol's price depends on its quality level, i.e., common, fine, exceptional, superb, and legendary.

The Disappointer is a great pistol that you can get early on, which offers amazing talents. For starters, its "Terrible" talent debuffs the enemy's attack by 10%. Meanwhile, the " Bleeding Lash" talent allows players to deal +10% bleed damage to enemies. It's a great weapon to use against regular enemies, but it can be extremely effective against larger bosses.

Pari The Disappointer with the Asfall's Legacy unique accessory, and you'll be able to do some serious damage to enemies in Avowed .

item.title: Pokemon Company CEO Thinks Franchise Will Hit Its 100th Anniversary
item.description:
Summary

  • The Pokemon Company CEO predicts the franchise could reach its 100th anniversary.
  • A recent Pokemon Presents event revealed exciting future plans for games and more.
  • The Pokemon Company looks to avoid a decline by not becoming complacent in success.

The CEO of The Pokemon Company recently revealed that he believes the Pokemon franchise will reach its 100th anniversary. These positive comments come as Pokemon recently celebrated Pokemon Day 2025, unveiling many announcements to look forward to over the coming year.

As one of the most popular media franchises in the world, Pokemon has experienced incredible growth over the last few decades. While the franchise began on the Game Boy in 1996 with the release of Pokemon Red and Green in Japan, it quickly expanded in subsequent years. In addition to nine generations of mainline games and numerous spin-off titles, Pokemon has branched into anime, merchandise, and much more. Thanks to its far-reaching appeal, even most non-gamers are familiar with the franchise and its recognizable mascot, Pikachu. With the 29th anniversary of the franchise having recently happened, the company has shared an optimistic view of the future.

In a recent interview with the BBC, Tsunekazu Ishihara, CEO of The Pokemon Company, revealed that the franchise could have many more years ahead of it. According to Ishihara, “If we continue focusing on our mission, Pokemon can probably continue to its 50th or 100th anniversary.” These predictions from the CEO seem viable, given the franchise’s success over the years. The mainline games continue to sell millions of copies, and mobile offerings like Pokemon TCG Pocket and Pokemon GO have been very popular. However, Ishihara warned of the dangers of complacency, saying the franchise could “go downhill” if they “go with the flow” instead of innovating on the brand.

Pokemon Has a Lot Planned for the Rest of 2025

These comments come as The Pokemon Company recently hosted a Pokemon Presents event. During the presentation, many significant announcements regarding the franchise were made. New content for existing games like Pokemon GO , Pokemon TCG Pocket , and Pokemon Unite were unveiled, and more episodes of Pokemon Concierge were announced for Netflix. In addition, the upcoming Pokemon Legends: Z-A revealed a look at gameplay, revealing the starters and more. There was even a new game reveal in Pokemon Champions , a new PvP game focused on battling Pokemon.

If we continue focusing on our mission, Pokemon can probably continue to its 50th or 100th anniversary.

With much of the roadmap for the rest of 2025 laid out, it will be interesting to see how successful The Pokemon Company is in the year ahead. While time will tell if the franchise makes it to its 100th anniversary, it looks like The Pokemon Company has no intentions of slowing down soon. As a result, Pokemon fans have lots to look forward to in the coming months.
